name: BEST WESTERN PLUS Inn of Santa Fe

reviews.text: My family stay for two nights in a double queen room. The room was clean, the beds were very comfortable and the hotel staff friendly and accommodating. The breakfast was decent with enough choice for the entire family.
reviews.title: Nice and comfortable!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This is a very nice property that has been recently renovated. The staff gave great advice on where to eat dinner and directions. The pool is super duper. Most indoor pools in hotels are hot and muggy but not this one. The hot-tub was a perfect temp.. Is on the south side of Santa Fe and close to I-25. We will stay there again next month.
reviews.title: Great Service Nice Hotel

reviews.text: this hotel is a solid choice in Santa Fe.
reviews.title: great hotel in Santa Fe

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: LOCATION: the location isn't the greatest but pretty much every major chain is located on the same strip outside of the downtown area. usually this is an annoyance however its a nice touch in this case since there are no hotels downtown and Santa Fe keeps this intimate feel.
reviews.title: Outstanding Motel

reviews.text: ROOM: the room is clean and nice. wifi is free but not super fast. nice lazyboy to hang out and kick back after a long day. the bathroom is a bit small but fine.
reviews.title: Solid option in Santa Fe

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I stayed just one night. The location is good; not too far off the I-25 and a few miles from Old Town Plaza. The room was clean, comfy, and not too small. The walls are a little thin as many hotels are, and we thought the rooms doors were quite loud if they were allowed to close without assistance. All in all, it's a good value for a short stay.
reviews.title: Convenient and Comfy!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The mobility accessible room here was clean, quiet and had plenty of room. Very nice bathroom and I could pull in under the sink with an inch or two clearance for my knees. But, the bed was at least 10 or 12 inches higher than my 22 inch high wheelchair seat. I really don't understand why such high beds are used in mobility accessible rooms as they are impossible to transfer onto. And so make the room inaccessible.
reviews.title: Wheelchair Accessibility review

reviews.text: My family (2 kids & husband) and I stayed here in october 2012 while visiting Santa Fe. We were here for two nights and were very happy with the cleanliness, quiet, friendliness of staff, location, and breakfast. It is not near Old Town, but it was very easy to get there, and the price much more affordable. The room was very clean and spacious for the 4 of us. Breakfast was good with both hot and cold choices, and plenty to go around. Even it was on a busy road, it is set back and very quiet in the hotel. i will be back again.
reviews.title: Wonderful place to stay!!!

reviews.text: We were passing through and wanted to stay here as we knew it had an indoor pool. We got a larger suite with a king and two queen beds. It had plenty of room, but I am glad we upgraded to a larger room as the room was very strangely set up and long and extremely narrow. The restroom was small enough that it was even difficult to close the door. That said, it had nice southwestern decor and was obviously recently updated. The hot tub wasn't working when we were there, but we would stay here again. A decent functional hotel.
reviews.title: Comfortable Hotel

reviews.text: Mr Sunny at this hotel, which is a fantastic hotel, weent out of his way to accomate my wife and I during our stay here for three days on a business trip. He is the normal person on duty during the day and I think he might be the owner, but regardless, he is a true professional and an asset to the Best Western name. Good job, Sunny!!
reviews.title: Sonny went the extra Mile

reviews.text: A bit out of the center of town, but the prices are lower than the in-town places also. It was clean, comfortable, and has a decent breakfast area. They seemed to be able to keep up with the breakfast crowd, and the place was full two of the three nights we were there. The food service line is a bit awkward, but that probably is due to the layout of the room.
reviews.title: Pleasant surprise

reviews.text: A very nice lounge area, comfortable and large. One could come here to read if your roommate was watching TV or sleeping.
reviews.title: Christmas Eve in Sante Fe

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Another situation where the used amenities and supplies were not always replaced. When I have to pay full rate for three nights, I would like three nights of amenities and coffee.
reviews.title: Really unbelievable--pinch me. Am I dreaming?

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The pets on the first floor can be noisy - we were on the second floor and could hear quite clearly the dog who was not happy about being closed in a room on the first floor.
reviews.title: loud closing doors and dogs barking but...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: But not a bad value for the money.
reviews.title: Clean and comfortable

reviews.text: Great location, staff very willing to help find a good restaurant. Rooms and hotel have been decorated with a beautiful southwestern decor. Continental breakfast was OK, i have seen much better it terms of selection and quality. Rooms are a nice size to fit a family of four.
reviews.title: Beautiful decor and good location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We truly enjoyed our stay here overall. The staff was very polite and friendly. Our room was much more than we expected, HUGE room and very nicely decorated. The room was so nice we thought maybe we had been put in the wrong room considering what we paid. The bed was one of the most comfortable hotel beds we'd every slept in. I guess the trend is going towards those "half pillows" though, but thankfully the hotel also provided standard sized pillows as well.
reviews.title: Great Night's Stay
Nice and comfortable
reviews.text: Complaints are relatively minor. There was a lot of noise in the hall throughout the evening, not loud talking or anything. I'm honestly not sure what it was but sounded like people bumping suitcases into the wall? This went on all evening.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Can't comment on the morning breakfast as we took one look at it and the crowd of people in the little room and decided to go out for breakfast. The breakfast room is TINY, and there were so many people you could barely get around.
reviews.title: needing an upgrade

reviews.text: My rating is a 4 based on cleanliness and creature comfort. We were very pleased with the overall condition of this location, despite the couple of minor inconveniences mentioned.
reviews.title: The Best of Best Western

aka: Best Western Plus Inn Of Santa Fe Hotel
description: The BW Inn of Santa Fe has completed a $1.5 million dollar renovation of it's exterior, public areas, and all 95 rooms. Our new decor has a southwestern flair w/ all three floors rooms having a different color scheme. We are also a 100% non-smoking facility. We have 16 suites including 2 family suites and some with balconies.
